message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Disagree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
I need to respond to all 10 statements about AI in education as a primary or secondary school teacher from Latvia. Let me think about reasonable responses from a teacher's perspective, considering both the potential benefits and risks of AI in education.

Let me go through each statement:

[TT4G35A] "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans." - This is a positive use case. AI can indeed help with drafting and improving lesson plans. I would "Agree" or "Strongly agree" with this.

[TT4G35B] "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities." - This is also a positive use case. AI can analyze student performance and help tailor materials. I would "Agree" or "Strongly agree".

[TT4G35C] "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually." - Positive use case. AI can help with personalized learning support. I would "Agree" or "Strongly agree".

[TT4G35D] "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs)." - This is also positive. AI has good potential for accessibility and support. I would "Agree" or "Strongly agree".

[TT4G35E] "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks." - Positive. AI can definitely help with grading, attendance, scheduling, etc. I would "Agree" or "Strongly agree".

[TT4G35F] "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own." - This is a negative risk. AI (like chatbots) can be used to generate content that students could pass off as their own. I would "Agree" or "Strongly agree" that this is true as a risk.

[TT4G35G] "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct." - This is a legitimate concern. AI can make errors or inappropriate suggestions. I would "Agree" or "Strongly agree".
 
[TT4G35H] "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions." - AI systems can perpetuate biases embedded in their training data, which is a serious concern. I would "Agree" with this risk.

[TT4G35I] "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data." - Data protection is a real concern when AI systems process sensitive student information. I would "Agree" or "Strongly agree".

[TT4G35J] "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students." - AI might not always grasp the nuances of effective teaching methods or classroom context, potentially recommending approaches that don't fit my students' needs.

As a teacher, I need to balance recognizing where AI genuinely helps—with lesson preparation, personalizing materials, supporting individual learners, improving accessibility, and handling administrative work—against legitimate concerns about accuracy, bias, privacy, and pedagogical soundness. My responses reflect both the practical benefits and the real risks I see in educational AI.
